image.altText: Meena Singh stands in an office and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: Victoria's children's commissioner has conceded "no-one" is overseeing key decisions of her office after revelations it failed to act on red flags raised about accused child abuser Joshua Brown.

title.children: 'No-one' overseeing key decisions, concedes Victoria's children's commissioner

image.altText: Two blue and white mushrooms on a tree branch.

props.synopsis: A mysterious world of colourful toadstools, ghostly mushrooms and bizarre white "cages" has emerged from the gloom.

title.children: From parasols to puffballs, Australian native fungi spring to life

image.altText: Dark grapes on a vine.

props.synopsis: A Victorian wine producer has cut his chemical usage after growing grapes resistant to disease.

title.children: Grape grower cuts out the chemicals to stand out in tight market

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering Clunes woman Hannah McGuire has entered a plea of guilty, eight days into his trial.

title.children: In shock move, Lachlan Young pleads guilty to murder of Hannah McGuire

image.altText: A man wearing a blue top and jeans and a woman in a red coat entering Walpole Hall alongside a door with a 'polling place' sign

props.synopsis: Independent MP for Kooyong Monique Ryan vows to introduce a bill to parliament aimed at lowering the minimum voting age, after the UK decided to reduce its voting age from 18 to 16.

title.children: Independent MP to push for lowering of Australian voting age

image.altText: A smiling older man leans on the wing of a small plane outside a hangar in a country area.

props.synopsis: A body believed to be that of a missing pilot has been located in the wreckage of a plane in the New South Wales Snowy Mountains.

title.children: Body found in search for pilot missing in NSW alps

image.altText: A billabong of water sits inbetween rows of River Red Gum trees.

props.synopsis: The First Peoples of the Millewa-Mallee in Victoria have been awarded native title status with exclusive rights, meaning other people will need their permission to access some designated areas.

title.children: Historic native title ruling gives traditional owners exclusive rights

image.altText: GettyImages-2222701381

props.synopsis: St Kilda coach Ross Lyon hits out at racist online trolls as the Saints prepare to face the Cats at Kardinia Park.

title.children: 'It was hate, it was vehement': Saints coach hits out at racist trolls

image.altText: Smoke and flames are seen billowing from a house on fire

props.synopsis: A woman has been charged with two counts of attempted murder after a fire in Melbourne's south-east left her and two children in a critical condition.

title.children: Woman appears in court on attempted murder charges of girls in house fire

image.altText: A middle-aged man with short, white hair looks angry as he stands outdoors on a grey day.

props.synopsis: A furious Victorian mayor says it is "disgraceful" that the EPA monitored toxic waste being dumped on council land for years only to leave ratepayers to foot the $500,000 clean-up bill.

title.children: Council faces $500k toxic waste clean-up EPA watched happen, mayor says

image.altText: parts of guns

props.synopsis: It is alleged the man sent the individual firearm parts to various addresses in Australia.

title.children: Police stop alleged black market plot to import 'deadly' gun parts

image.altText: Two women with arms on their hips in a large hall, some dancers hang around a stage

props.synopsis: Three of Ukraine's most celebrated dancers have travelled from war-torn Kyiv to Australia to conduct a week-long traditional dance masterclass.

title.children: Honoured Ukrainian dancers 'pass legacy on' as war continues

image.altText: A swift parrot perching on a branch

props.synopsis: A gathering of close to the total estimated population of swift parrots excites ecologists, but they warn it is no party for the critically endangered species.

title.children: Massive flock of critically endangered swift parrots seen in one spot

image.altText: A close-up shot of a newborn baby's hand inside an adult hand.

props.synopsis: Researchers in the United Kingdom have announced the successful birth of eight babies after a clinical trial of an IVF technique known as mitochondrial donation.

title.children: What is mitochondrial donation and why is it called 'three-person IVF'?

image.altText: Zach Merrett leads Essendon players onto the ground

props.synopsis: Essendon has been hit with an injury toll that has rarely been seen in professional sports. ABC Sport spoke to a physiotherapist to help gain an understanding of the various factors that result in professional athletes getting hurt.

title.children: As Bombers battle injury bug, these silent factors lead to athletes getting hurt

image.altText: A man and woman pose for a selfie in a busy street.

props.synopsis: Gry Tømte has written an emotional tribute to her husband, who was allegedly stabbed during a botched break and enter on Sunday night.

title.children: Wife of slain Sunshine Coast man says he was her 'entire world'

image.altText: The mangled remains of a vehicle near an SUV and a ute, also seriously damaged, on a road. Emergency personnel are nearby.

props.synopsis: Victorian man Peter Agius sent and received more than 80 Snapchat messages in the lead-up to the 2023 crash that killed Adam Sutton, who had just picked his son up from his first day of school.

title.children: Jail for Snapchatting driver who killed young dad, gave 6yo brain damage

image.altText: large graffiti letters on a rock wall

props.synopsis: Two men are arrested and one is charged, after the discovery of a 10-metre piece of vandalism on a rock face on Taungurung Country in Victoria's Alpine National Park.

title.children: Two men arrested after graffiti found at culturally significant site

image.altText: A group of people pose for a photo, all are blurred except for Erin Scutter in the front row, wearing a pink top.

props.synopsis: The aviation sector was home to two of the nation’s most high-profile murderers, however documents reveal Airservices Australia and CASA have not reviewed their systems of psychometric testing.

title.children: Little discussion of high-profile murders at CASA, Airservices Australia

image.altText: A group of GWS players surround a smiling forward after he has kicked a goal.

props.synopsis: The Bombers finish strongly to stop GWS clinching a big percentage boost, but the Giants enter the top four as Jake Stringer has a big night against his old club.

title.children: GWS crack top four as Jake Stringer has big night against old club Bombers

image.altText: Five people stand around a person who is sitting on the ground with his hands handcuffed behind his back.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged over the theft of a car connected to the December 2024 fire that destroyed the Adass Israel Synagogue in Melbourne's inner south-east.

title.children: Terror unit charges man over theft of car linked to Melbourne synagogue attack

image.altText: David with his plane

props.synopsis: The wreckage of the plane was located on Thursday afternoon by a rescue helicopter, with NSW Police yet to provide an update on the pilot.

title.children: Wreckage found during search for plane missing in NSW Snowy Mountains

image.altText: Young man wearing beanie and glasses sits across a bench with legs straight out in front and a laptop in his lap.

props.synopsis: A new study finds neurodiverse uni students are concerned about being labelled if they ask for support, and that training for staff on how best to support neurodivergent students is "sorely needed".

title.children: Neurodiverse uni students say discrimination and lack of support rife

image.altText: The arm of an unidentified child playing with toys

props.synopsis: Joshua Dale Brown was sacked from a Melbourne childcare centre months before joining another centre, where he is accused of committing child sex offences.

title.children: Accused child sex offender Joshua Dale Brown sacked from former childcare employer

image.altText: burnt weatherboard house with police tape out front

props.synopsis: Police say a 77-year-old man who died in a house fire north of Ballarat was a "local identity" who was well-known in the community.

title.children: Man dies in central Victorian house fire

image.altText: An aerial photo of a crane lifting a train carriage off a section of curved track.

props.synopsis: Massive commuter disruptions continue across Melbourne's north-east as significant repair works get underway following train derailment.

title.children: Last carriage removed from tracks after train derailment in Melbourne

image.altText: A large, gran, historic-looking building with "Court House" lettered on the facade.

props.synopsis: Courts across Victoria are closing to the public on days without scheduled hearings, prompting concerns about access to justice in regional communities.

title.children: More Victorian courts to shut on non-sitting days

image.altText: A young man with tousled blond hair, wearing a long-sleeved black top, with his arms folded

props.synopsis: Brandon Jack draws on his time as a peripheral player in the AFL in his raucous new novel, Pissants.

title.children: Ex-footballer pens debut novel set in debauched AFL fringe

image.altText: Several people holding down a teenage boy in an aeroplane

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old boy is being assessed for a neurological condition after allegedly attempting to hijack a Jetstar plane at a major Victorian regional airport, a court hears.

title.children: Teen to undergo neurological exam after alleged plane hijack attempt

image.altText: Middle aged man pointing into a wetland with his black dog.

props.synopsis: The once-degraded Heart Morass wetland in eastern Victoria is now thriving as research shows restoring wetlands could be a powerful tool in fighting carbon emissions and guarding against floods and drought.

title.children: Community-led wetlands revival goes to heart of climate fight

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a cap and hoodie sits next to a shelf with a photo of a smiling teenager and a candle on it.

props.synopsis: The remains of Charlie Gander were found in a burnt-out car in northern Victoria in 2022. Charlie's dad, Richard, says he is devastated that only one of the three people tried has been found guilty of murder.

title.children: Father of murdered teenager 'shattered' by Supreme Court jury verdict

image.altText: Man wearing a black shirt that says 'Burgertory' on the collar, with his arms folded.

props.synopsis: Fast-food chain boss Hash Tayeh has quit as CEO of Burgertory, less than a month after being hit with a $1 million tax bill for debts allegedly run up by 12 companies.

title.children: Burgertory CEO quits amid 'targeted attacks' and $1 million tax bill

image.altText: A man climbs through the window of a moving van.

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly led police on a dramatic chase across Melbourne in a stolen van on Friday, before jumping out the window and being hit by a pursuing police car, has been refused bail.

title.children: Man refused bail after allegedly leaping from van in dramatic chase

image.altText: Evrim Sen inside her tiny house.

props.synopsis: Evrim Sen's tiny house on wheels has allowed her to have the serene and idyllic lifestyle she'd always dreamed of. But a council will see that come to an abrupt end.

title.children: Council issues building orders to shocked tiny home residents
